an5.209:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks in reciting with a drawn-out singing sound.
an5.209:4.3: You relish the sound of your own voice. Others relish the sound of your voice. Householders complain:
an5.209:4.4: ‘These ascetics, followers of the Sakyan, sing just like us!’ When you’re enjoying the vocal arrangement, your samādhi breaks up. Those who come after follow your example.
an5.209:4.5: These are the five drawbacks in reciting with a drawn-out singing sound.”
